Description: Warlocks are people who made pacts with powerful beings.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).

~Proficiency in Anything~.Effect:
Think of something specific your character is good at outside of combat (e.g. things like acrobatics, knowing about monsters, lying, etc).
Whenever you make a Check for what you're good at, add your Level to that Check.
~Proficiency in Anything~.Notes: For a full list of proficiencies, see the Proficiencies page.

Mana.Regain: Your Mana reset after every combat.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells (not Talents) when taking a Long Rest.
Spellcasting.Other: All Warlock-specific Abilities are considered Spells.

~Power Tap~.Effect:
Cast an ability one of your Allies has (with that ability's Actions and Costs and your modifiers).
If it costs Mana, you must spend its Mana.
~Power Tap~.Notes: Does not work on Passives. The Ability must have 0, a Half-Action or 1 Actions cost.

Starting Abilities Description.Spell Casting:
Warlock spell casting is somewhat different from other classes.
Your Mana regenerates inbetween combat encounters. So, for optimal play, use all your Mana every encounter!

Starting Abilities Description.Power Tap:
Try to clone strong Abilities from your teammates that don't take up Mana.
Talent Abilities are generally stronger than standard Spell List Abilities.

Abilities Description.Fey Patron:
A wild, outworldly being, heavily magical or in tune with nature, and often outward strange. A Fey Patron often represents an old god of nature or magic, resembled by a magical animal or humanoid.
This provides you with the Fey Patron Ability, which gives you one more Race Choice Ability!

Abilities Description.Celestial Patron:
A being from a divine plain. Portrayed as angels or divine spirits of life and death.
This provides you with the Life Cycle Ability which can function as an emergency heal in combat. This Ability can be used on yourself, too.
Note that it simply draws from the Reserve Health pool! It is not Health out of thin air!

Abilities Description.Demon or Devil Patron:
A being residing in Hell, an archdevil or lord in hell.
This provides the Soul Drain Ability, which gives you a consistent Damage source that can heal you back.

Abilities Description.Old God Patron:
An eldritch being of nightmare and terror, whose thoughts, form and wants are incomprehensible to most people
This gives you access to one of another Race's Starting Ability.

~Fey Patron~.Effect:
Your lord is a higher fey creature.
Choose one more Race Ability from your Race's choices.
~Fey Patron~.Notes:
Yes, you will have 2 Race Abilities from the Race Ability choices.
Lore-wise, the Fey Patron enhances you magically, mutates your arcane flow and transforms you into an unordinarily adapted person.
If you are a Human, pick one more first Race Ability from another Race.
If you are a Dragonborn, your Breath has both chosen shapes simultanuously.

~Celestial Patron~.Effect: Your lord is a celestial being, who lives in a higher plane. You gain Life Cycle.
~Celestial Patron~.Notes: The gift of Life Cycle is granted to you by your patron. Use it well. Withhold the balance.

~Old God Patron~.Effect:
Your lord is an old, slumbering god.
You can pick a Racial Ability from any other race and have it permanently (not from the Race Ability Choices, but from the Starting Abilities).
~Old God Patron~.Notes: Eldritch thoughts flow through your mind, infecting you with strange abilities acquired in unfathomable ways.

<Life Cycle>.Effect: Heal a Unit within 10 meters for up to 10 Health from their remaining Reserve Health Pool.

~Demon Patron~.Effect:
Your lord is a powerful demon.
You gain Soul Drain.
~Demon Patron~.Notes: Through every soul drained, your demon lord feeds, and in return, grants you even more power.

<Soul Drain>.Effect:
Deal 7 Necrotic damage to a creature (directly, not against Defense).
If it dies, you get the Mana back and heal for 5 Health.

Specializations.Description: At Level 1, you can choose your specialization. Every Warlock can choose from the following Warlock specializations.
Choices: Hexblade, a user of both magic and a weapon infused with the power of their master
Summoner, specialized in calling for aid from familiars and otherworldly beings

~Sentient Weapon~.Effect:
You have a Hexblade Weapon, inside which your patron's avatar lies, either possessing the weapon, being trapped inside it or using it as a means of communication with you.
Pick any weapon type (e.g. Shortsword, Longbow, Pike, etc), and it becomes your Hexblade Weapon.
You can customize your weapon's personality, voice, the way it looks. Talk to your DM about this.
You are automatically considered trained in your Hexblade Weapon.

~Hexblade~.Effect: After you cast an offensive spell, your next attack with your Hexblade Weapon deals +1d6 damage.
~Hexblade~.Upgrade: The bonus damage becomes 1d8 at Level 5.
~Hexblade~.Notes: Offensive means that it deals damage or applies hard Crowd Control (anything better than Slow and creating Hard Terrain).

<Shapeshifting Weapon>.Effect: Instantly change the type of weapon of your Hexblade.

<Hexstaff>.Effect:
Your Hexblade Ability is replaced by Hexstaff:
After you attack with a weapon, your next offensive spell has +1 Counter Check Grade and deals +1d6 damage.
<Hexstaff>.Upgrade: The bonus damage becomes 1d8 at Level 5.

<Doublehex>.Effect:
You now have 1 more Hexblade Weapon, of any kind. The same patron or another one is possessing your second weapon.
At any time, you can vanish or resummon either weapon.

<Hungering Weapon>.Effect: When YOU drop a Worthy Enemy to 0 Health, gain an extra Half-Action this turn and Shielding equal to your Main Stat.

<Spell Tap>.Effect: Every Worthy Combat, when you drop to 0 Mana, reset the Cooldown of Power Tap and gain Shielding equal to your Main Stat.

<Somatic Pulse>.Effect:
Count the Units within 3 meters of you (except you).
They are all attacked for 2d6 + (the number of Units) True damage (against Defense).
<Somatic Pulse>.Notes: E.g. if this affects 2 Units, it deals 3d6. If it affects 3 Units, it deals 4d6. 4 Units - 5d6. And so on.

~Summon Familiar~.Effect:
You conjure a ritual for 1 hour.
The first time you cast this ritual, you summon a familiar which becomes yours.
You can choose what your familiar looks like, assuming it is a small creature.
Also, choose an element which is bound to it: Fire, Water, Frost, Arcane, Thunder, Earth, Wind, Light or Darkness. That becomes your Familiar's Element.
Your familiar comes with a name that the GM decides.
The familiar doesn't take turns on its own, but at the same time as you.
On your turn, your familiar can use its own movement to move, but you must spend your own Actions for it to take actions.
If your familiar goes more than 30 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned.
If it dies, it becomes unsummoned.
You can always summon it back with this Ability.
The stat block for the Familiar is on the Pets and Animals page.
~Summon Familiar~.Notes:
You can communicate with your Familiar telepathically.
The Familiar can be classified as a demon, undead, celestial, monstrosity, etc (but not beast or humanoid).

~Familiar Pet Attack~.Effect:
The familiar melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d12 + Main Stat damage (of your pet's elemental type).
~Familiar Pet Attack~.Notes: The attack is against target's Defense, of course.

~Familiar Feats~.Effect:
You also have access to the Familiar Feats.
You can choose one Familiar Feat to get for free.

<Tongues>.Effect:
You speak all Common and Wild languages.
You have +1 Counter Check Grade.

<Impmaster>.Effect: When you get this Talent, gain 1 Feat.

<Dream Walk>.Effect:
A Unit must pass a Wisdom Check or fall Asleep for 2 turns.
Alternatively, you can use Dream Walk on an already sleeping target to alter their dreams to your liking.
<Dream Walk>.Notes: A Sleeping Unit wakes up if it takes damage or other Crowd Control.

<Patron Aspect>.Effect:
You take on the shape or a being from your patron's plane until the end of your next turn.
You have +2 Defense, +2 Main Stat, and your Generic Spells require no mana to cast.
After you cast a Generic Spell for free, it goes on a Long Rest Cooldown.

<Dual Summonation>.Effect:
Summon 2 Dual-Imps at any spaces within 6 meters and choose a target.
These 2 imps will cast Chase Bolt and chase their target to death. Otherwise, they don't move from their spot.
They last for 10 minutes or until thet target is defeated or they can't attack it.
Imps take their turn immediately after you.
See the Pets section for the Dual-Imp stats.
<Dual Summonation>.Notes:
Imps become unsummoned at the start of their turn if the target dies or it becomes untargetable or invisible; Imps will chase around corners, though. Imps don't care about Cover; they attack anyway.
Imps aren't very smart, they don't employ tactics.

<Patron Avatar>.Effect:
You summon an Avatar of your patron.
While the Avatar is summoned, you can't move, except with teleportation Spells.
You and the Avatar share Actions and you must use at least a Half-Action with it every turn, otherwise it becomes unsummoned.
The Avatar can't take damage or be directly Crowd Controlled, but all Crowd Control you would take is redirected to it.
See the Avatar's Stats and Abilities in the Pets sections.
Lasts up to 1 minute or until you are Stunned, Paralyzed or physically moved from place, or if the Avatar moves outside of a 30 meter range.
<Patron Avatar>.Notes: You can cancel the summon at any point on your turn.
